Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory45.jpg'}
{3: "You follow Bridget onto a bridge on an observation deck, where you can peer into space and that planet—Earth, a 4.6-billion-year-old miracle, and humanity's only home."}
{3: 'In the vast emptiness of space, existence is beautifully solitary.'}
{3: 'Before her, Babylonia is but an infant still attached to its umbilical cord.'}
{3: 'Bridget sets down her drink and sits cross-legged on the observation bridge. You sit down next to her.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bridget', 3: "Beautiful, isn't it? Few people come here. That's why I love it here.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'I come here to clear my head whenever things get too much.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Bridget lowers her head. Her bangs cast a shadow over her eyes, hiding her expression.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bridget', 3: '【kuroname】, have you ever wondered...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'What kind of life would we be living now if the Punishing Virus had never existed?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Of course, I have.', 3: '16', 4: "I've never thought about that.", 5: '16'}
{3: 'Bridget silently gazes at Earth, lost in thought.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bridget', 3: "Whenever I sit here and gaze at Earth, I can't help but wonder...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: "If it weren't for the Punishing... Mom and Dad would still be alive.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'I would have had a normal childhood. I would go to school, come home after classes, and spend weekends shopping with my parents.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'Maybe Mom would have made me take dance lessons. She always loved telling us how she taught Dad to waltz.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'And the cotton candy...', 4: '1'}
{3: "Bridget's voice trails off, and she pauses for a moment."}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'The first time I had cotton candy was when Dad got one for me. I was so little at the time that most memories have faded, but I still remember...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'It was so sweet... very, very sweet...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She throws her head back and chugs her electrolyte, emptying the can before falling back onto her back.'}
{3: "It's your first time seeing Bridget so vulnerable. You cannot find your voice, so you simply copy her and lie down beside her."}
{3: 'Bridget seems to see right through your thoughts.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bridget', 3: "Don't try to comfort me.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: "I'm really happy you accepted my invitation today. Thank you, 【kuroname】.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'I should be the one thanking you.', 3: '37'}
{2: "I'm glad you invited me out today.", 3: '38'}
{3: 'The spherical observation deck lets you see the cosmos while lying down.'}
{3: 'Bridget extends her right hand as if trying to trap a star in her palm.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bridget', 3: '【kuroname】, I really like it here.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'I love Babylonia. I love everyone who lives here. I love the entire Earth, and I love all the civilizations humanity has built.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'There is no more sadness in her voice.'}
{3: 'Bridget suddenly leans down. You see her face against the night sky. Her hands are planted on either side of your head.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bridget', 3: 'I love you, too, 【kuroname】.', 4: '1'}
{3: "A visible blush spreads on Bridget's cheeks—is it from the alcohol-flavor electrolyte?"}
{3: 'Her face is so close that you can feel her breath.'}
{3: 'Your heart skips a beat, and your breathing grows unsteady.'}
{2: "You're... a bit too close...", 3: '53'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'I told you...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: "A commandant who can't read the room won't be very popular...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'I told you right from the start—this is a date.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'And you accepted my invitation.', 4: '1'}
{2: '(Close your eyes)', 3: '58'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{3: 'A feather-light touch grazes your forehead. It is so faint and gentle that it might very well be... your imagination...'}
{3: 'But in the next moment, a soft whisper drifts into your ear.'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: "I'm drunk... Blame the electrolytes..."}
{3: 'Her warm breath tickles your ear.'}
{3: 'Your heart pounds faster and faster.'}
{3: "You can no longer tell if you're hearing your own heartbeat or the humming of Bridget's core."}
{3: 'Maybe... everything would be different?'}
{3: 'Bridget rises slowly to her feet.'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: '【kuroname】, look! The sun is rising!'}
{2: '(Open your eyes)', 3: '71'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryZhengyanNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory45.jpg'}
{3: "Sunrises aren't hard to see in Babylonia. Sometimes you can even see several in a single day. Yet you still find yourself staring."}
{3: "The curved horizon glows red as dawn breaks, bathing both the earth and half of Bridget's figure in its light."}
{3: 'She spreads her arms as if embracing the starlit sky with her whole being.'}
{3: 'Bridget turns to you, her face still covered in dirt, and flashes a radiant smile.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bridget', 3: "I'm a very ambitious person, 【kuroname】.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'I hate conflict and death, and I want peace.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'I believe everyone deserves to live with equal rights and dignity.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'All the ordinary people living under this dome, and the ones on the planet below, I want to help them all. I want to reclaim Earth.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'Humanity might be forced to leave Earth behind one day, but I refuse to flee in disgrace.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'If that day does come, I hope humanity will leave Earth like children leaving home—carrying both fond memories of Earth and hope for their future.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'I believe this was the real vision of those who built Babylonia during the Golden Age.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'Haha, look at me rambling on and on.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'Ah, I feel much better.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'Just... chalk all that up to drunk rambling, will you?', 4: '1'}
{2: "I don't think that was drunk rambling at all.", 3: '90'}
{3: 'This is the Bridget I know—not a delicate flower, but an iron that is covered in soil and forged in flame.'}
{2: 'I know you have never stopped pursuing your ideals.', 3: '93'}
{3: 'Words would feel too empty for this mood, as some feelings cannot be conveyed through words. So...'}
{2: "Waltz—you've told me before.", 3: '99'}
{3: 'A faint smile appears on her lips.'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'Hahaha, hahahaha...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Her laughter grows louder and louder.'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'Some of those rumors about you will surely include me from now on.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: "Alright, let's dance!", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Under the stars and the Milky Way, you join hands and begin to dance.'}
{3: 'The universe and the night sky that only observed now seem enchanted, and suddenly blaze with newfound brilliance.'}
{3: 'Starlight cascades over her, painting her in an ethereal gentle glow.'}
{3: 'You need no music, no routine—only the freedom to move as your hearts guide you.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory45.jpg'}
{3: 'Your eyes meet when the dance ends, and everything—the galaxy, the cosmos, and time itself—fades away.'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'Thank you, Commandant, for treating me as someone special.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Words are redundant as thoughts and feelings flow effortlessly between you.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'And thank you for sharing everything with me.', 3: '118'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: "Let's brave whatever destiny has in store for us—together.", 4: '1'}
